channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Labour accused of ‘performative cruelty’ over asylum plans – UK politics live
item.description: SNP and Plaid Cymru say government facilitating Farage’s agenda with proposals to drastically tighten rules Momentum , the leftwing Labour group, has ...

item.title: Trump continues to attack Marjorie Taylor Greene despite his call to release Epstein files – live
item.description: President repeats assertion that former ally is a ‘traitor’ even as he urges fellow Republicans to vote for release of documents relating to sex offen...

item.title: Ousted Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death for crimes against humanity
item.description: Hasina sentenced in absentia by court in Dhaka over deadly crackdown on student-led uprising last year Bangladesh’s deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasi...

item.title: UK downplays reports it has stopped sharing intelligence with US regarding narco-traffickers
item.description: ‘Longstanding intelligence and law enforcement frameworks’ are continuing, Yvette Cooper says UK politics live – latest updates US politics live – lat...

item.title: Foreign state services behind Polish rail sabotage, says minister – Europe live
item.description: Security services minister Tomasz Siemoniak says explosion was not the work of ‘a gang of metal thieves’ Back to Poland, the country’s interior minist...

item.title: Agency staff covering for Birmingham bin strike vote to take industrial action
item.description: Unite say the staff are not crossing picket lines, due to intimidation at the council's refuse section.

item.title: British hacker must repay £4m after hijacking celebrity Twitter accounts
item.description: Joseph O'Connor, from Liverpool, hacked more than 130 accounts in July 2020 to promote a Bitcoin scam.

item.title: Ukraine to import US liquefied natural gas via Greece
item.description: Vital supplies are due to start flowing from the Balkans as energy infrastructure faces sustained Russian attack.

item.title: Trump reverses position and urges own party to vote for release of Epstein files
item.description: "We have nothing to hide," the US president writes - a reversal after previously resisting publishing the documents.

item.title: School bans singing of KPop Demon Hunters songs
item.description: The head teacher tells parents references to demons can feel "deeply uncomfortable" to Christians.
